class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">Whitepaper 2015 industry_drilldown_finance_en</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save Whitepaper 2015 industry_drilldown_finance_en for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R5mlm9i7d6:" popovertarget=":R5mlm9i7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R5mlm9i7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R5mlm9i7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R5mlm9i7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/Bankir_Ru">Bankir_Ru</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">The document summarizes key findings from a report on cyber threats targeting the financial services sector. The top three findings are:

1. Financial services encounters security incidents 300% more frequently than other industries due to being a prime target. 

2. 33% of all reconnaissance and lure attacks target financial services, indicating large efforts to compromise financial institutions. 

3. Credential stealing attacks are prominent, with the top threats like Rerdom, Vawtrak, and Geodo having credential theft capabilities. Geodo is seen 400% more in financial services.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rlm9i7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rlm9i7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="whatsHot-card-description-11" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rm69i7d6:" popovertarget=":Rm69i7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rm69i7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/grift-horse-money-stealing-trojan-takes-10m-android-users-for-a-ride/250374640"><span class="sr-only">Grift horse money stealing trojan takes 10m android users for a ride</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:11" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="Grift horse money stealing trojan takes 10m android users for a ride" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/grifthorsemoney-stealingtrojantakes10mandroidusersforaride-211005132120-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">Grift horse money stealing trojan takes 10m android users for a ride</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save Grift horse money stealing trojan takes 10m android users for a ride for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R5mm69i7d6:" popovertarget=":R5mm69i7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R5mm69i7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R5mm69i7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R5mm69i7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/RoenBranham">Roen Branham</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Watch the full episode on Youtube:  https://youtu.be/M5Gsjwsnxtg

More than 10 million Android users have been saddled with a malware called GriftHorse that’s trojanizing various applications and secretly subscribing victims to premium mobile services – a type of billing fraud that researchers categorize as “fleeceware.”
Zimperium uncovered more than 130 GriftHorse apps being distributed through both Google Play and third-party application stores, across all categories. Some of them have basic functionality, and some of them do nothing, researchers said. In either case, once installed, they lead to victims being billed for premium services – but phone-owners are usually none the wiser until they take a look at their mobile bills.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rm69i7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rm69i7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="whatsHot-card-description-12" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rmm9i7d6:" popovertarget=":Rmm9i7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rmm9i7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/estado-del-ransomware-en-2020/237380418"><span class="sr-only">Estado del ransomware en 2020</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:12" document summarizes key trends in cybercrime in 2017, including a massive 34,000% increase in coin mining detections as criminals shifted focus from ransomware. Ransomware detections remained high but did not break the 2016 record. Targeted banking Trojan Emotet reemerged and increased 2000%. The document also discusses the notable WannaCry and Petya attacks but notes they were exceptions and do not represent overall ransomware trends in 2017.</span></div></div><div class="" class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/MicrosoftAsia">Microsoft Asia</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">This document summarizes the key findings of a study on the link between pirated software and cybersecurity breaches:

1) The study found that consumers and enterprises have a 33% chance of encountering malware when obtaining pirated software or buying a PC with pirated software pre-installed. A forensic analysis of 203 PCs found 61% were infected with malware. 

2) Consumers will spend $25 billion dealing with security issues caused by malware on pirated software in 2014. Enterprises will spend $491 billion, with $315 billion resulting from criminal organizations&#x27; activities. 

3) Asia Pacific will incur over 40% of worldwide consumer losses and over 45% of enterprise losses from malware on pir</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Ro69i7d6:" popover="auto" attacks against the financial institutions

class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">Ransomware-as-a-Service: The business of distributing cyber attacks</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save Ransomware-as-a-Service: The business of distributing cyber attacks for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R5mp69i7d6:" popovertarget=":R5mp69i7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R5mp69i7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R5mp69i7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R5mp69i7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/DrGiorgosKKassapis">Δρ. Γιώργος K. Κασάπης</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Ransomware is proving to be a profitable endeavor for cyber criminals. It is also what is fueling a newer trend: the business of offering management of ransomware attacks, or Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS).

Fueled in part by the ability to use cryptocurrency to avoid detection, cyber criminals are setting up shop as a managed service provider, helping other cyber criminals conduct business on their platforms for a fee. For that fee, cyber criminal groups get personalize access to platforms, complete with dashboard capabilities, that allow them to easily distribute their ransomware. Also included – technical support. Such full-service offerings mean that nearly anyone with internet access can launch a ransomware attack without any technical knowledge needed.

And why not? The estimated return on investment from ransomware campaigns can easily reach 1400%. The lure of a lucrative return could well attract beginners or anyone with a grudge. For organizations, the threat coming from a well-backed beginner is as damaging as one coming from a career criminal.
</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rp69i7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rp69i7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/rsa-monthly-online-fraud-report-august-2013/26048481"><span class="sr-only">RSA Monthly Online Fraud Report -- August 2013</span></a><div SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">The document outlines 11 strategies for publishers to survive in the platform era: 1) Obsess over differentiation, 2) Become experts in brand management, 3) Maintain direct relationships with audiences, 4) Be selective in platform partnerships, 5) Reinvent brand advertising and reduce reliance on programmatic, 6) Monetize collected data, 7) Define the right video strategy, 8) Think globally but act locally, 9) Create niche content verticals, 10) Leverage unique abilities unlike platforms, and 11) Prioritize talent acquisition and execution.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rgmai7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R5mi6ai7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R5mi6ai7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/dhaine">dhaine</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">This document summarizes a study on sampling strategies to control misclassification bias in longitudinal udder health studies. The study uses simulations of 100 cohorts of 30 cows each over 2 time points to estimate the impact of selection and misclassification biases on incidence and associations. It finds that duplicate or triplicate sampling can help control biases, especially when prevalence is high and test sensitivity is fair. The best strategies are to improve test sensitivity at baseline and specificity at follow-up. Bias can be evaluated using the R package developed by the authors.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Ri6ai7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Ri6ai7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="alsoLiked-card-description-4" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rimai7d6:" popovertarget=":Rimai7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rimai7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://es.slideshare.net/slideshow/un-buen-medico-de-familia/48804274"><span class="sr-only">Un Buen Médico de Familia.</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K Aquí tenéis la versión en castellano fruto de vuestras peticiones.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rimai7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Lecture at IUC Turin as part of a Module on Social Food Movements. Here I present the right to food constituency, NGOs, associations, legal scholars and the few institutions and countries that actually support politically and financially this fundamental right (closely linked to right to life). I explore major barriers (normative, academic and political) to the full implementation, and analyse the different developments in Latin America (progress) and Europe (stalemate). ciudadania  2016</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:13" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/udelchoco">Universidad del Chocò</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">La Universidad Tecnológica del Chocó Diego Luis Córdoba, junto a toda la línea directiva presenta a toda la comunidad por medio de la Rendición de Cuentas los logros y metas durante la vigencia 2016 que son el resultado del trabajo conjunto y en minga de toda la comunidad Universitaria.
 
El rector Eduardo Antonio García Vega, tendrá la gran responsabilidad de entregar por medio de cifras, datos la buena gestión, igualmente, interactuar con otros entes administrativo o público interesado para dar garantía sobre la transparencia de la administración pública y posibilitar el acceso a la información.
 
Desde 1972 hasta hoy la UTCH viene cumpliendo en la formación de profresionales exitosos de alto nivel, en la mejora continua  de los procesos y procedimientos, son 45 años en el que día a día sea ha trabajado en la consolidación de la Universidad acreditada de calidad con enfoque </span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rn6ai7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rn6ai7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="alsoLiked-card-description-14" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rnmai7d6:" popovertarget=":Rnmai7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rnmai7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/philosophy-of-deep-learning/73990448"><span class="sr-only">Philosophy of Deep Learning</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:14" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="Philosophy of Deep Learning" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/philosophyofdeeplearning-170330165955-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="Philosophy of Deep Learning" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/philosophyofdeeplearning-170330165955-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">Philosophy of Deep Learning</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save Philosophy of Deep Learning for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R5mnmai7d6:" popovertarget=":R5mnmai7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R5mnmai7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R5mnmai7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R5mnmai7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/lablogga">Melanie Swan</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Deep Qualia: Philosophy of Statistics, Deep Learning, and Blockchain

Deep learning: What is it, why is it important, and what do I need to know? 

The aim of this talk is to discuss deep learning as an advanced computational method and its philosophical implications. Computing is a fundamental model by which we are understanding more about ourselves and the world. We think that reality is composed of patterns, which can be detected by machine learning methods. 

Deep learning is a complexity optimization technique in which algorithms learn from data by modeling high-level abstractions and assigning probabilities to nodes as they characterize the system and make predictions. An important challenge in deep learning is that these methods work in certain domains (image, speech, and text recognition), but we do not have a good explanation for why, which impedes a wider application of these solutions.

Another recent advance in computational methods is blockchain technology which allows the secure transfer of assets and information, and the automated coordination of operations via a trackable remunerative ledger and smart contracts (automatically-executing Internet-based programs). 

This talk looks at how deep learning technology, particularly as coupled with blockchain systems, might be used to produce a new kind of global computing platform. The goal is for blockchain deep learning systems to address higher-dimensional computing challenges that require learning and dynamic response in domains such as economics and financial risk, epidemiology, social modeling, public health (cancer, aging), dark matter, atomic reactions, network-modeling (transportation, energy, smart cities), artificial intelligence, and consciousness. 
</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rnmai7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rnmai7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="alsoLiked-card-description-15" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Ro6ai7d6:" popovertarget=":Ro6ai7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Ro6ai7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/deadpool-movie-leaked-script-1/35671973"><span class="sr-only">Deadpool movie leaked script (1)</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:15" slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/zacharygoldrich">Zachary Goldrich</a><div class="slideshow-stats He jumps through the windshield of an SUV transporting prisoners, taking on its occupants. The SUV spins out of control and flips over, with Deadpool and others frozen in mid-air. Deadpool breaks the fourth wall by looking directly at the camera at the end.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Ro6ai7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="alsoLiked-card-description-16" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Romai7d6:" popovertarget=":Romai7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Romai7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://pt.slideshare.net/slideshow/bio-3ano-frente3-aula02-tegumento-animais-presentation/881441"><span class="sr-only">O Tegumento dos Animais</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:16" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">O Tegumento dos Animais</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save O Tegumento dos Animais for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R5momai7d6:" popovertarget=":R5momai7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R5momai7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R5momai7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R5momai7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/biraneves">Ubirajara Neves</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">O documento discute o tegumento dos animais, descrevendo suas principais características e funções em diferentes grupos. Resume que o tegumento protege os animais contra desidratação, choques e patógenos, variando em complexidade de uma única membrana em protozoários a múltiplas camadas de células e anexos como pelos e glândulas em vertebrados.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Romai7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Romai7d6"></div></div><div SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">The document outlines a training agenda for a cyber security conference held in August 2015. Day 1 covers topics like cyber crimes, the current situation in Indonesia and globally, and identifying threats and vulnerabilities. Day 2 focuses on information security strategies across organizations and envisioning the future state. Several sessions explore defining cyber crimes, common attack types like viruses and denial of service, and who carries out cyber crimes. The document also discusses trends like the growing cyber crime marketplace, risks to mobile devices, larger attacks on retailers and banks, and more advanced targeted threats.</span></div></div><div slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/bluesme">- Mark - Fullbright</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Botnets have grown larger, more resilient, and better camouflaged. They are finding new ways to generate revenue through ransomware and bitcoin mining. Android malware is also evolving, with threats becoming more sophisticated at avoiding detection and removal. While no single Android malware is dominant, the most widespread is Andr/BBridge-A, which has demonstrated longevity since first being detected in 2012. There are some signs of progress, such as Google improving Android security and the arrest of an exploit kit author, but threats continue advancing techniques.</span></div></div><div class="" Days</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">The document discusses targeted attacks on financial institutions. It provides information on:

1) Known targeted attackers like Cobalt, Corkow, and Anunak and their favorite targets like ATMs, card processing, and SWIFT systems. 

2) Future targeted attackers that may go after financial networks. 

3) The common targets of these attacks, which include corporate internet banking software, payment gateways, ATMs, trade terminals, and SWIFT/ARM CBR systems.

4) The malware delivery methods used by these groups, such as driveby downloads, pay-per-install, web hacks, phishing emails, and spear phishing.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Ri6bi7d6:" slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/AbdullahAlGhamdi4">Abdullah Al-Ghamdi</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">1. Sophos Labs predicts 10 cyber security trends for 2014, including attacks targeting cloud access through endpoints, mobile devices, and credentials as businesses increase cloud migration. 

2. Financial malware is expected to adopt techniques of advanced persistent threats normally used for cyber espionage, making them more difficult to detect. 

3. Android malware will become more complex, seeking new targets by using mobile devices as platforms to attack social networks and cloud services.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rj6bi7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rj6bi7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="similarTo-card-description-6" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rjmbi7d6:" popovertarget=":Rjmbi7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rjmbi7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/manu-quintans-frank-ruiz-50-shades-of-crimeware-rooted-con-2014/33911487"><span class="sr-only">Manu Quintans &amp; Frank Ruiz – 50 shades of crimeware [Rooted CON 2014]</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save Manu Quintans &amp; Frank Ruiz – 50 shades of crimeware [Rooted CON 2014] for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R5mjmbi7d6:" popovertarget=":R5mjmbi7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R5mjmbi7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R5mjmbi7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R5mjmbi7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/rootedcon">RootedCON</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Manu Quintans and Frank Ruiz will be giving a presentation on cybercrime trends observed between 2013 and 2014. They will discuss the evolution of cybercrime activities and infrastructure, including the rise of point of sale malware targeting payment card data, new mobile malware using TOR anonymity networks, and the growing use of cryptocurrencies. They will provide a detailed example of the 2013 Target breach that resulted in over 70 million customer records being stolen. The presentation will include a demonstration of malware samples.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rjmbi7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rjmbi7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="similarTo-card-description-7" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rk6bi7d6:" popovertarget=":Rk6bi7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rk6bi7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/january-2014-wss-webinar-slides/29872490"><span class="sr-only">Website Security Threats - January 2014 Update </span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:7" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="Website Security Threats - It discusses cybercrime statistics from the month including money earned by cybercriminals and numbers of stolen payment cards and user credentials. New types of malware like malicious Firefox add-ons and malware disguising as IIS servers are covered. Reasons for growing interest in IT risk like lack of visibility and interconnectedness are summarized. High profile hacks impacting millions of users are briefly outlined.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rk6bi7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/CYREN">Cyren, Inc</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">This document summarizes a CYREN webinar on mobile malware and phishing trends from Q2 2014. It finds that ransomware expanded to Android devices, along with banking malware targeting SMS messages. Zbot variants continued spreading through email attachments and Dropbox links. PDF and Word documents were also used to distribute malware. Phishing targeted World Cup-related brands and global banks. Spam levels decreased while pump-and-dump stock scams increased. The webinar reviewed CYREN&#x27;s security products and cloud-based threat intelligence designed to help partners.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rkmbi7d6:" popover="auto" slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/codeblue_jp">CODE BLUE</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">There are frequent discussions of Russian related cyber-attacks, but these mainly focus on attribution of infrequent Nation State and government related incidents. This presentation focuses on what is more important to the information security community, the large and active eco-system of Russian speaking cyber criminals, whose attacks target business and information security teams daily worldwide. 

ロシア語圏のサイバー犯罪事情 by Tim Bobak (Group-IB)
ロシア関連のサイバー攻撃については頻繁に議論がなされている。しかしこれは主にあまり発生しない国家や政府が関係するインシデントに焦点が当てられている。
本講演では、情報セキュリティコミュニティにとってより重要と考えられる、全世界のビジネスやセキュリティチームに対して日々攻撃を仕掛ける、サイバー犯罪に従事するロシア語圏の大規模で積極的なエコシステムに焦点を当てる。</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rl6bi7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rl6bi7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="similarTo-card-description-10" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rlmbi7d6:" popovertarget=":Rlmbi7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rlmbi7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/21284433-ga-customerfacingpptistrv190414/33247513"><span class="sr-only">Symantec Internet Security Threat Report 2014 - Volume 19</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:10" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="Symantec Internet Security Threat Report 2014 - Volume 19" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/21284433gacustomerfacingpptistrv1904-140407192302-phpapp02-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="Symantec Internet Security Threat Report 2014 - Volume 19" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/21284433gacustomerfacingpptistrv1904-140407192302-phpapp02-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">Symantec Internet Security Threat Report 2014 - Volume 19</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save Symantec Internet Security Threat Report 2014 - Volume 19 for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R5mlmbi7d6:" popovertarget=":R5mlmbi7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R5mlmbi7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R5mlmbi7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R5mlmbi7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/symantec">Symantec</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">The 2014 Internet Security Threat Report gives an overview of global threat activity for the past year based on data from Symantec’s Global Intelligence Network.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rlmbi7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rlmbi7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="similarTo-card-description-11" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rm6bi7d6:" popovertarget=":Rm6bi7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rm6bi7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/symantec-internet-security-threat-report-2009/3882874"><span class="sr-only">Symantec Internet Security Threat Report - 2009</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:11" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="Symantec Internet Security Threat Report - 2009" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/symantecglobalinternetsecuritythreatreport-istrapril2010-100428065439-phpapp02-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="Symantec Internet Security Threat Report - 2009" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/symantecglobalinternetsecuritythreatreport-istrapril2010-100428065439-phpapp02-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">Symantec Internet Security Threat Report - 2009</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save Symantec Internet Security Threat Report - 2009 for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R5mm6bi7d6:" popovertarget=":R5mm6bi7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R5mm6bi7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R5mm6bi7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R5mm6bi7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/guest6561cc">guest6561cc</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">This document is Symantec&#x27;s annual Global Internet Security Threat Report. It analyzes trends in threats, vulnerabilities, and other security issues from 2009. Some key findings include:

- Countries like the US, China, and India were major sources of malicious activity. Web-based attacks and phishing remained prevalent threats. 

- Vulnerabilities in browsers and browser plugins posed risks. Exploits targeting vulnerabilities in Java, Adobe Reader, and other widely used programs were common.

- The number of new malicious code increased significantly in 2009. Trojans and botnets were widely used. 

- Phishing targeted many industries, especially financial services. Automated phishing toolkits made phishing</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rm6bi7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rm6bi7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY Presentatie Kaspersky: Malware en statistieken. Welke trends neemt Kaspersky waar mbt malware, wat zijn de motieven en wat kun je hier tegen doen? - Door Jornt van der Wiel, Security Researcher, Kaspersky Lab Benelux</span></div></div><div class="" 2...</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:15" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">Kaspersky Lab’s Webinar ‘Emerging Threats in the APT World: Predictions for 2...</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save Kaspersky Lab’s Webinar ‘Emerging Threats in the APT World: Predictions for 2... for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R5mo6bi7d6:" popovertarget=":R5mo6bi7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R5mo6bi7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R5mo6bi7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R5mo6bi7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/KasperskyLabGlobal">Kaspersky</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">For several years now, Kaspersky Lab’s Global Research and Analysis Team (GReAT) has been monitoring more than 60 threat actors responsible for cyber-attacks worldwide. By closely observing these organizations, which appear to be fluent in many languages, including Russian, Chinese, German, Spanish, Arabic and Persian, we have put together a list of what seem to be the emerging threats in the APT world. We think these will play an important role in 2015 and deserve special attention. As a participant of the webinar, you will be the first to hear our detailed analysis of the trends. 

The webinar was hosted by Costin Raiu, Director of GReAT at Kaspersky Lab, on December 11.
“If we can call 2014‘sophisticated’, then the word for 2015 will be ‘elusive’. We believe that APT groups will evolve to become stealthier and sneakier, in order to better avoid exposure. This year we’ve already discovered APT players using several zero-days, and we’ve observed new persistence and stealth techniques. We have used this to develop and deploy several new defense mechanisms for our users,” comments Costin Raiu.
Listen to the presentation https://kas.pr/aptwebinar
Read the full report https://kas.pr/ksb</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Ro6bi7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Ro6bi7d6"></div><div RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">This time every year, I sit down with my research teams 
and we talk about what we think the coming year will hold 
in terms of threats to our customers. It’s an important 
discussion that helps us not only share with you what we 
think you need to be prepared for, but also to help guide our 
direction as we continue to build products and services to

class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">Online financial fraud infographic</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save Online financial fraud infographic for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R5mp6bi7d6:" popovertarget=":R5mp6bi7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R5mp6bi7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R5mp6bi7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R5mp6bi7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/prayukth1">Prayukth K V</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Cybercriminals prefer attacking bank customers directly rather than hacking banks. They do this through phishing emails with fake banking forms, spoofing of legitimate banking websites, and intercepting unprotected internet connections to steal users&#x27; financial credentials and data. Malware like Trojans also intercept keystrokes and screenshots to steal sensitive banking information from infected computers and mobile devices. Over 1.8 million users encountered financial malware in 2013, losing hundreds of millions of dollars to online financial fraud and theft.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rp6bi7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rp6bi7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="similarTo-card-description-18" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rpmbi7d6:" popovertarget=":Rpmbi7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rpmbi7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/global-threatlandscape-report-by-fortinet/238372147"><span class="sr-only">Global threat-landscape report by fortinet.</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:18" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="Global threat-landscape report by fortinet." data-cy="slideshow-title">2015 Cybercrime Trends – Things are Going to Get Interesting</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save 2015 Cybercrime Trends – Things are Going to Get Interesting for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R5mq6bi7d6:" popovertarget=":R5mq6bi7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R5mq6bi7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R5mq6bi7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R5mq6bi7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/ibmsecurity">IBM Security</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">What a year 2014 has been for cybercriminals! It’s time to take a look back at 2014 and learn what’s in store for 2015. How much further will cybercriminals go? What new techniques will we see? What are the main threats we should be wary of in 2015? 

From new malware families to PC grade mobile malware, from persistent PC Trojans to cloud based criminal services –cybercriminals have been keeping busy with new and advanced techniques. 

In this session, IBM Security’s Senior Fraud Prevention Strategist, Etay Maor, will take you through the top stories that made waves in in 2014’s cybercrime threat environment and review at the upcoming cybercrime trends for 2015. 

We will look some of the biggest (and baddest) in cybercrime innovation, showcasing specific attacks that highlight the ingenuity observed in 2014 and discuss what we can expect in terms of PC and mobile fraud in 2015. 

In this presentation, you will learn about: 

– Latest malware attacks and evasion techniques 
– How organizations failed to prevent attacks in 2014 
– Forecast of how recent attacks will affect attacks in 2015

View the full on-demand webcast: https://attendee.gotowebinar.com/recording/4171628843485100290</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rq6bi7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" 2025</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:0" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">Protecting Your Sensitive Data with Microsoft Purview - IRMS 2025</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save Protecting Your Sensitive Data with Microsoft Purview - IRMS 2025 for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R5mgmci7d6:" popovertarget=":R5mgmci7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R5mgmci7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R5mgmci7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R5mgmci7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/NikkiChapple">Nikki Chapple</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Session |  Protecting Your Sensitive Data with Microsoft Purview: Practical Information Protection and DLP Strategies

Presenter | Nikki Chapple  (MVP|  Principal Cloud Architect  CloudWay) &amp; Ryan John Murphy (Microsoft)
Event |  IRMS Conference 2025
Format |  Birmingham UK
Date | 18-20 May 2025

In this closing keynote session from the IRMS Conference 2025, Nikki Chapple and Ryan John Murphy deliver a compelling and practical guide to data protection, compliance, and information governance using Microsoft Purview. As organizations generate over 2 billion pieces of content daily in Microsoft 365, the need for robust data classification, sensitivity labeling, and Data Loss Prevention (DLP) has never been more urgent.

This session addresses the growing challenge of managing unstructured data, with 73% of sensitive content remaining undiscovered and unclassified. Using a mountaineering metaphor, the speakers introduce the “Secure by Default” blueprint—a four-phase maturity model designed to help organizations scale their data security journey with confidence, clarity, and control.

🔐 Key Topics and Microsoft 365 Security Features Covered:

Microsoft Purview Information Protection and DLP
Sensitivity labels, auto-labeling, and adaptive protection
Data discovery, classification, and content labeling
DLP for both labeled and unlabeled content
SharePoint Advanced Management for workspace governance
Microsoft 365 compliance center best practices
Real-world case study: reducing 42 sensitivity labels to 4 parent labels
Empowering users through training, change management, and adoption strategies

🧭 The Secure by Default Path – Microsoft Purview Maturity Model:

Foundational – Apply default sensitivity labels at content creation; train users to manage exceptions; implement DLP for labeled content.
Managed – Focus on crown jewel data; use client-side auto-labeling; apply DLP to unlabeled content; enable adaptive protection.
Optimized – Auto-label historical content; simulate and test policies; use advanced classifiers to identify sensitive data at scale.
Strategic – Conduct operational reviews; identify new labeling scenarios; implement workspace governance using SharePoint Advanced Management.

🎒 Top Takeaways for Information Management Professionals:

Start secure. Stay protected. Expand with purpose.
Simplify your sensitivity label taxonomy for better adoption.
Train your users—they are your first line of defense.
Don’t wait for perfection—start small and iterate fast.
Align your data protection strategy with business goals and regulatory requirements.

💡 Who Should Watch This Presentation?

This session is ideal for compliance officers, IT administrators, records managers, data protection officers (DPOs), security architects, and Microsoft 365 governance leads. Whether you&#x27;re in the public sector, financial services, healthcare, or education.

🔗 Read the blog: https://nikkichapple.com/irms-conference-2025/</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rgmci7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">Dr Jimmy Schwarzkopf presentation on the SUMMIT 2025 A</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save Dr Jimmy Schwarzkopf presentation on the SUMMIT 2025 A for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R5mh6ci7d6:" popovertarget=":R5mh6ci7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R5mh6ci7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R5mh6ci7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R5mh6ci7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/jimmyschwarzkopf">Dr. Jimmy Schwarzkopf</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Introduction and Background:
Study Overview and Methodology: The study analyzes the IT market in Israel, covering over 160 markets and 760 companies/products/services. It includes vendor rankings, IT budgets, and trends from 2025-2029. Vendors participate in detailed briefings and surveys.
Vendor Listings: The presentation lists numerous vendors across various pages, detailing their names and services. These vendors are ranked based on their participation and market presence.
Market Insights and Trends: Key insights include IT market forecasts, economic factors affecting IT budgets, and the impact of AI on enterprise IT. The study highlights the importance of AI integration and the concept of creative destruction.
Agentic AI and Future Predictions: Agentic AI is expected to transform human-agent collaboration, with AI systems understanding context and orchestrating complex processes. Future predictions include AI&#x27;s role in shopping and enterprise IT.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rh6ci7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rh6ci7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="latest-card-description-2" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rhmci7d6:" popovertarget=":Rhmci7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rhmci7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/measuring-microsoft-365-copilot-and-gen-ai-success/279826756"><span class="sr-only">Measuring Microsoft 365 Copilot and Gen AI Success</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:2" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="Measuring Microsoft 365 Copilot and Gen AI Success" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/measuringcopilotandgenaisuccessecs2025-250528221342-61d291fb-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">Measuring Microsoft 365 Copilot and Gen AI Success</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R5mhmci7d6:" popovertarget=":R5mhmci7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R5mhmci7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R5mhmci7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R5mhmci7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/NikkiChapple">Nikki Chapple</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Session |  Measuring Microsoft 365 Copilot and Gen AI Success with Viva Insights and Purview
Presenter | Nikki Chapple 2 x MVP and Principal Cloud Architect at CloudWay
Event |  European Collaboration Conference 2025
Format |  In person Germany
Date | 28 May 2025

📊 Measuring Copilot and Gen AI Success with Viva Insights and Purview
Presented by Nikki Chapple – Microsoft 365 MVP &amp; Principal Cloud Architect, CloudWay

How do you measure the success—and manage the risks—of Microsoft 365 Copilot and Generative AI (Gen AI)? In this ECS 2025 session, Microsoft MVP and Principal Cloud Architect Nikki Chapple explores how to go beyond basic usage metrics to gain full-spectrum visibility into AI adoption, business impact, user sentiment, and data security.

🎯 Key Topics Covered:

Microsoft 365 Copilot usage and adoption metrics
Viva Insights Copilot Analytics and Dashboard
Microsoft Purview Data Security Posture Management (DSPM) for AI
Measuring AI readiness, impact, and sentiment
Identifying and mitigating risks from third-party Gen AI tools
Shadow IT, oversharing, and compliance risks
Microsoft 365 Admin Center reports and Copilot Readiness
Power BI-based Copilot Business Impact Report (Preview)
📊 Why AI Measurement Matters: Without meaningful measurement, organizations risk operating in the dark—unable to prove ROI, identify friction points, or detect compliance violations. Nikki presents a unified framework combining quantitative metrics, qualitative insights, and risk monitoring to help organizations:

Prove ROI on AI investments
Drive responsible adoption
Protect sensitive data
Ensure compliance and governance
🔍 Tools and Reports Highlighted:

Microsoft 365 Admin Center: Copilot Overview, Usage, Readiness, Agents, Chat, and Adoption Score
Viva Insights Copilot Dashboard: Readiness, Adoption, Impact, Sentiment
Copilot Business Impact Report: Power BI integration for business outcome mapping
Microsoft Purview DSPM for AI: Discover and govern Copilot and third-party Gen AI usage
🔐 Security and Compliance Insights: Learn how to detect unsanctioned Gen AI tools like ChatGPT, Gemini, and Claude, track oversharing, and apply eDLP and Insider Risk Management (IRM) policies. Understand how to use Microsoft Purview—even without E5 Compliance—to monitor Copilot usage and protect sensitive data.

📈 Who Should Watch: This session is ideal for IT leaders, security professionals, compliance officers, and Microsoft 365 admins looking to:

Maximize the value of Microsoft Copilot
Build a secure, measurable AI strategy
Align AI usage with business goals and compliance requirements

🔗 Read the blog https://nikkichapple.com/measuring-copilot-gen-ai/</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rhmci7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rhmci7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="latest-card-description-3" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Ri6ci7d6:" popovertarget=":Ri6ci7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Ri6ci7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/evaluation-challenges-in-using-generative-ai-for-science-technical-content/280036221"><span class="sr-only">Evaluation Challenges in Using Generative AI for Science &amp; Technical Content</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:3" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="Evaluation Challenges in Using Generative AI for Science &amp; Technical Content</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save Evaluation Challenges in Using Generative AI for Science &amp; Technical Content for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R5mi6ci7d6:" popovertarget=":R5mi6ci7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R5mi6ci7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R5mi6ci7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R5mi6ci7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/pgroth">Paul Groth</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Evaluation Challenges in Using Generative AI for Science &amp; Technical Content.   

Foundation Models show impressive results in a wide-range of tasks on scientific and legal content from information extraction to question answering and even literature synthesis. However, standard evaluation approaches (e.g. comparing to ground truth) often don&#x27;t seem to work. Qualitatively the results look great but quantitive scores do not align with these observations. In this talk, I discuss the challenges we&#x27;ve face in our lab in evaluation. I then outline potential routes forward.  </span></div></div><div class="" id=":Ri6ci7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Ri6ci7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="latest-card-description-4" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rimci7d6:" popovertarget=":Rimci7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rimci7d6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/nix-os-for-python-developers-pycon-25-bologna-italia/279927019"><span class="sr-only">Nix(OS) for Python Developers - the next Dev Dives webinar on May 29 for a first contact with UiPath API Workflows, a powerful tool purpose-fit for API integration and data manipulation!
This session will guide you through the technical aspects of automating communication between applications, systems and data sources using API workflows. 

📕 We&#x27;ll delve into: 
- How this feature delivers API integration as a first-party concept of the UiPath Platform. 
- How to design, implement, and debug API workflows to integrate with your existing systems seamlessly and securely.  
- How to optimize your API integrations with runtime built for speed and scalability.  
This session is ideal for developers looking to solve API integration use cases with the power of the UiPath Platform.  

👨‍🏫 Speakers: 
Gunter De Souter, Sr. Director, Product Manager @UiPath 
Ramsay Grove, Product Manager @UiPath

Generati..." src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/agenticai-250528081506-61c0e0e4-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">Agentic AI Explained: The Next Frontier of Autonomous Intelligence &amp; Generati...</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save Agentic AI Explained: The Next Frontier of Autonomous Intelligence &amp; Generati... for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R5mk6ci7d6:" popovertarget=":R5mk6ci7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R5mk6ci7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":R5mk6ci7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-R5mk6ci7d6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/kansariaaryan520">Aaryan Kansari</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Agentic AI Explained: The Next Frontier of Autonomous Intelligence &amp; Generative AI
Discover Agentic AI, the revolutionary step beyond reactive generative AI. Learn how these autonomous systems can reason, plan, execute, and adapt to achieve human-defined goals, acting as digital co-workers. Explore its promise, key frameworks like LangChain and AutoGen, and the challenges in designing reliable and safe AI agents for future workflows.

Sticky Note Bullets:

Definition: Next stage beyond ChatGPT-like systems, offering true autonomy.

Core Function: Can &quot;reason, plan, execute and adapt&quot; independently.

Distinction: Proactive (sets own actions for goals) vs. Reactive (responds to prompts).

Promise: Acts as &quot;digital co-workers,&quot; handling grunt work like research, drafting, bug fixing.
 
Industry Outlook: Seen as a game-changer; Deloitte predicts 50% of companies using GenAI will have agentic AI pilots by 2027.

Key Frameworks: LangChain, Microsoft&#x27;s AutoGen, LangGraph, CrewAI.

Development Focus: Learning to think in workflows and goals, not just model outputs.

Challenges: Ensuring reliability, safety; agents can still hallucinate or go astray.

Best Practices: Start small, iterate, add memory, keep humans in the loop for final decisions.

Use Cases: Limited only by imagination (e.g., drafting business plans, complex simulations).</span></div></div><div class="" id=":Rk6ci7d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rk6ci7d6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div Join me, a Data Security Consultant and Microsoft MVP, as I share practical tips and tricks to get the full potential of sensitivity labels. aria-describedby="latest-card-description-11" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rm6ci7d6:" popovertarget=":Rm6ci7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rm6ci7d6"><a class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">New Ways to Reduce Database Costs with ScyllaDB</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save New Ways to Reduce Database Costs with ScyllaDB for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R5mm6ci7d6:" popovertarget=":R5mm6ci7d6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R5mm6ci7d6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span
